posts.body:
>>64b8195e-c267-4b71-9c9c-f0696fcbe2ae
If you're on some kind of unix, use a cronjob. Here's mine. It will not work on any cron implementation, read the manual for yours.
@weekly 5 sharethread-repo-update	cd '/media/windows/Users/'$LOGNAME'/Documents/image/Information/An ode to anonymity and piracy/share thread/stv' ; git pull ; cd $OLDPWD
>>2381b758-f304-491c-bf6d-e748353e32e0
>>4d319847-ee16-499a-aca6-fca8c8e7af96
FLAC should always be available if it exists. Distribute it in whatever other format you want, but make sure FLAC is available. You can make every other format from FLAC.
You technically can from lossy formats, but double-encoding something lossily is dumb should be avoided at all costs. It's a non-option.
